moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. e5 Bf5 4. Nc3 Qb6
comment:
After the carnage inflicted by
Kasparov in round 5, Karpov wisely sidesteps any possibility of repetition by
avoiding the main-line.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. e5 Bf5 4. Nc3 Qb6 5. Nf3 e6 6. Be2 Ne7 7. O-O Bg4
comment:
More often seen
is 7 ..Nd7, but there is no real difference here as the line tends to go 7 ..
Nd7 8 b3 Bg4.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. e5 Bf5 4. Nc3 Qb6 5. Nf3 e6 6. Be2 Ne7 7. O-O Bg4 8. Na4 Qc7 9. b3 b5
comment:
This may be a bit too committal - Grischuk
can take advantage of Karpov's lack of development to open the game now. Maybe
the cautious 9 ..Nd7 was to be preffered.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. e5 Bf5 4. Nc3 Qb6 5. Nf3 e6 6. Be2 Ne7 7. O-O Bg4 8. Na4 Qc7 9. b3 b5 10. Nb2 Nd7 11. c4 bxc4 12. bxc4 dxc4 13. Ng5 Bxe2 14. Qxe2 Nb6 15. Nxc4 Nf5 16. Rd1 Be7 17. Nf3 Nxc4 18. Qxc4 Qd7 19. g4 Nh4 20. Nxh4 Bxh4 21. g5 h6 22. d5 hxg5 23. Qxc6 Rc8 24. Qxd7+ Kxd7 25. d6 f6
comment: The locked in bishop on h4 causes Karpov trouble.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. e5 Bf5 4. Nc3 Qb6 5. Nf3 e6 6. Be2 Ne7 7. O-O Bg4 8. Na4 Qc7 9. b3 b5 10. Nb2 Nd7 11. c4 bxc4 12. bxc4 dxc4 13. Ng5 Bxe2 14. Qxe2 Nb6 15. Nxc4 Nf5 16. Rd1 Be7 17. Rd1+ Ke5 33. Be3 Kf6 34. Rdd7 Rd8 35. Bxg5+ Bxg5 36. Rdf7+ Ke5 37. Rxg5+ Kd4 38. Ra7 Rb1+ 39. Kg2 Rb2 40. Raxa5 Rf8 41. Ra4+ Kd3 42. Rg3+ Kd2 43. Rxe4
comment: The rest is academic now: White easily wins.
